Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbstständig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben möchten. 

Wir sind kürzlich als der globale Herstellungspartner für die Produktion der Moderna Impfung gegen den Coronavirus bestätigt worden. Als Partner ermöglichen wir eine Verzehnfachung der Produktionskapazität. Wir sind in der glücklichen Lage, in Zeiten grosser Unsicherheit für viele Unternehmen, die Möglichkeit nachhaltigen Wachstums zu haben.  Aufgrund dieser neuen Zusammenarbeit wird unsere Arbeit einen entscheidenden, direkten und lang anhaltenden Einfluss auf die  Bewältigung dieser globalen Pandemie haben.

 

Ihre Aufgaben:

  • Sichere Arbeitsausführung unter Einhaltung der Sicherheitsvorschriften SiVo und Arbeitsanweisungen und Betriebsordnung
  • Spricht Mitarbeiter bei Abweichungen aktiv an
  • Selbstständige Ausführung und Protokollierung von Arbeitsabläufen
  • Rundgänge in der Produktionsanlage gemäss den Vorgabedokumenten unter Berücksichtigung von GMP
  • Umsetzung des Fachwissen sowie Unterstützung aller Kollegen
  • Erkennen und Melden von unsicheren Zuständen
  • Ausführung von technischen Tätigkeiten und Produktionsabläufe sowie sehr gute Kenntnisse der Prozessleitsysteme

 

Was wir von Ihnen erwarten:

  • Technische oder kaufmännische Ausbildung
  • Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • Grundkenntnisse in Englisch wünschenswert
  • Kenntnisse über Produktionsabläufe und Zusammenhänge eines grossen Produktionsbereiches
  • Ein-und Ausfahren einzelner Anlagen und Betriebe
  • Gute Kenntnisse der Verfahrenstechnik
  • Durchführen der Grundoperationen in mehreren Anlagen 

Lonza’s Produkte und Services wirken sich täglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. Für uns stellt dies nicht nur eine grosse Ehre, sondern auch eine grosse Verantwortung, dar. Wie wir unsere Geschäftsergebnisse erreichen ist für uns genauso wichtig wie unsere Erfolge selbst. Bei Lonza wird Respekt groß geschrieben und wir schützen sowohl unsere Mitarbeiter als auch unsere Umwelt. Erfolg für uns bedeutet moralisch vertretbarer Fortschritt.  

 

Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Ansätze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lösen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen.

job.title: Verkäufer (m/w) 50% , Teilzeit
job.plaincontent:
- Im Wesentlichen sind Sie für folgende Tätigkeiten zuständig - Das Idealprofil beinhaltet - Wir bieten als nachhaltiger und fairer Arbeitgeber - Ihr Arbeitsort - Ihr Kontakt
Verkäufer (m/w)
Döttingen, 50%
Volg ist im ländlichen Raum und in den Dörfern bis in die entlegensten Täler der Schweiz zu hause. In über 580 Dorfläden wird frisch und fründlich das Sortiment für den täglichen Bedarf angeboten. Der Volg-Laden mit attraktiven Öffnungszeiten ist ein Treffpunkt im Dorf und bietet eine persönliche Einkaufsatmosphäre.
Für unsere Filiale in 5312 Döttingen AG suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine verantwortungsbewusste und motivierte Persönlichkeit.
Im Wesentlichen sind Sie für folgende Tätigkeiten zuständig
• frisch und fründliche Beratung und Betreuung unserer Kundschaft • Sicherstellen der konzepttreuen und ansprechenden Warenpräsentation • Sortimentsbestellungen und Warenbereitschaft • Fachgerechte Behandlung von Frischprodukten (Früchte, Gemüse etc.) • Kassenbedienung
Das Idealprofil beinhaltet
• Freude am aktiven Kundenkontakt • Eine Ausbildung oder Erfahrungen im Verkauf (vorteilsweise in der Branche Nahrungs- und Genussmittel) • Sozial- und Fachkompetenz
Wir bieten als nachhaltiger und fairer Arbeitgeber
• Eine professionelle Einführung • Breite Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten durch unsere Volg-Academy • Ein attraktives Gesamtpaket aus guten Mitarbeiterkonditionen, Sozialleistungen und Anstellungsbedingungen • Ein dynamisches und familiäres Umfeld
Ihr Arbeitsort
5312 5312 Döttingen AG
Ihr Kontakt

job.title: Anlage- und Apparatebauer in Rohrbautechnik
job.plaincontent: Lonza ist heute ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15‘000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tätig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafür, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lösung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbstständig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben möchten. Für unseren Standort in Visp suchen wir eine/n Anlage- und Apparatebauer/in. Der ANAP-Rohrbau ist für das fachgerechte Ändern, Reparieren, Herstellen und Montieren von anspruchsvollen Rohrleitungen zuständig. Ausmessen, Isometrieren, sowie die Planung und Disposition gehören auch zu seinem Tätigkeitsgebiet. Zudem stellt er den Betrieb während des Pikettdienstes sicher. Ihre Aufgaben: - Fachgerechtes und wirtschaftliches Ändern, Reparieren, Herstellen und Montieren von anspruchsvollen Rohrleitungen und Anlageteilen nach Skizzen und Zeichnungen - Ausmessen und Isometrieren von anspruchsvollen Anlageteilen - Planung und Dispositionen von kompletten Anlageteilen - Koordination der Arbeitsabläufe in Abstimmung mit dem Teamleiter und den Auftraggebern - Umstellung von Anlagenteilen nach R+I Fliessbild - Schweissarbeiten - Beratung und Unterstützung der Auftraggeber - Kennt die Einsatzmöglichkeit und Handhabung der vorhandenen Ausmessmittel - Kennt die SOP PED Richtlinie. - Erweiterter Umgang mit CAD, SAP, LSO, DMS, Office - Betreuung und Unterstützung von Lehrlingen Ihr Anforderungsprofil - Sie haben eine abgeschlossene Lehre als Anlage- und Apparatebauer Fachrichtung C, Rohrschlosser oder anverwandter Beruf - Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Rohrschlosser ist von Vorteil - Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse sind zwingend - Selbständige und genaue Arbeitsweise - Sie arbeiten kundenorientiert und sind offen für Neues - Kommunikationsfähigkeit, Initiative und Belastbarkeit runden Ihr Profil ab Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Ansätze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lösen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen. job.title: Business Development Manager CDMO
job.plaincontent: Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. As part of Lonza Specialty Ingredients (LSI), you join the Specialty Chemical Services (SCS) team in Basel. With its holistic service offering along the whole value chain, SCS Contract Development and Manufacturing Organizations (CDMO) builds on 2 technology platforms – Chemistry in Visp, CH and Biotechnology in Kouřim, CZ. As Business Development Manager CDMO, you are working close together with our external customers on continued extension of the project pipeline and renewal of the product portfolio manufactured in those SCS assets. This involves assessing the current pipeline, filling it with new business opportunities and improving our overall competitive position. To achieve this you will work in close collaboration with both CDMO and Operations teams. Key responsibilities: - Continuously monitor and analyze the global biotechnology market and identify new business opportunities including new trends, growth areas, customers, products and services - Understand the needs of the industry and respective companies, seek out the appropriate contacts in new organizations, generate new leads and cold call prospective customers - Full project accountability from the first customer contact, via inquiry and contract negotiations, until completion of the commercial manufacturing agreement - Close cross-functional cooperation during project acquisition and execution with the business unit, R&D, production, sourcing, legal and other departments - Customer account planning and sales reporting - Support the business strategy by developing a portfolio of customers and a healthy project pipeline - Represent SCS at international conferences and trade shows - Satisfy the needs of your customers with a high level of service and a continuous dialogue Key requirements: - Strong network and experience in sales and new business development, sound understanding of new markets, growth areas, trends, customers, products and services in the biotechnological and/or chemical industry with focus on various business segments such as food, feed, nutrition, cosmetics, agricultural applications; understanding of red biotechnology is a plus - Background in industrial application of natural sciences (Biotech or Chemistry) in a CDMO type of company is a must - Ability to create new customer contact strategies - Excellent project management skills to support customers from early stage inquiries until commercial manufacturing - Creative, convincing, proactive in building and maintaining strong and trustful customer relationships - Act with high sense of urgency, strong in working autonomously and team collaboration skills - Fluent English, German is a plus - Willingness for traveling approximately 20% Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference. Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. With its holistic service offering along the whole value chain, SCS Contract Development and Manufacturing Organizations (CDMO) builds on 2 technology platforms – Chemistry in Visp, CH and Biotechnology in Kouřim, CZ. This involves assessing the current pipeline, filling it with new business opportunities and improving our overall competitive position. To achieve this you will work in close collaboration with both CDMO and Operations teams. understanding of red biotechnology is a plus - Background in industrial application of natural sciences (Biotech or Chemistry) in a CDMO type of company is a must - Ability to create new customer contact strategies - Excellent project management skills to support customers from early stage inquiries until commercial manufacturing - Creative, convincing, proactive in building and maintaining strong and trustful customer relationships - Act with high sense of urgency, strong in working autonomously and team collaboration skills - Fluent English, German is a plus - Willingness for traveling approximately 20% Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.
job.htmlcontent:
</div>

 

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

As part of Lonza Specialty Ingredients (LSI), you join the Specialty Chemical Services (SCS) team in Basel.

With its holistic service offering along the whole value chain, SCS Contract Development and Manufacturing Organizations (CDMO) builds on 2 technology platforms – Chemistry in Visp, CH and Biotechnology in Kouřim, CZ. As Business Development Manager CDMO, you are working close together with our external customers on continued extension of the project pipeline and renewal of the product portfolio manufactured in those SCS assets. This involves assessing the current pipeline, filling it with new business opportunities and improving our overall competitive position. To achieve this you will work in close collaboration with both CDMO and Operations teams.

Key responsibilities:

  • Continuously monitor and analyze the global biotechnology market and identify new business opportunities including new trends, growth areas, customers, products and services
  • Understand the needs of the industry and respective companies, seek out the appropriate contacts in new organizations, generate new leads and cold call prospective customers
  • Full project accountability from the first customer contact, via inquiry and contract negotiations,  until completion of the commercial manufacturing agreement
  • Close cross-functional cooperation during project acquisition and execution with the business unit, R&D, production, sourcing, legal and other departments
  • Customer account planning and sales reporting
  • Support the business strategy by developing a portfolio of customers and a healthy project pipeline
  • Represent SCS at international conferences and trade shows   
  • Satisfy the needs of your customers with a high level of service and a continuous dialogue

Key requirements:

  • Strong network and experience in sales and new business development, sound understanding of new markets, growth areas, trends, customers, products and services in the biotechnological and/or chemical industry with focus on various business segments such as food, feed, nutrition, cosmetics, agricultural applications; understanding of red biotechnology is a plus
  • Background in industrial application of natural sciences (Biotech or Chemistry) in a CDMO type of company is a must
  • Ability to create new customer contact strategies
  • Excellent project management skills to support customers from early stage inquiries until commercial manufacturing
  • Creative, convincing, proactive in building and maintaining strong and trustful customer relationships
  • Act with high sense of urgency, strong in working autonomously and team collaboration skills
  • Fluent English, German is a plus
  • Willingness for traveling approximately 20%
     

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

</div>

 

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

As part of Lonza Specialty Ingredients (LSI), you join the Specialty Chemical Services (SCS) team in Basel.

With its holistic service offering along the whole value chain, SCS Contract Development and Manufacturing Organizations (CDMO) builds on 2 technology platforms – Chemistry in Visp, CH and Biotechnology in Kouřim, CZ. As Business Development Manager CDMO, you are working close together with our external customers on continued extension of the project pipeline and renewal of the product portfolio manufactured in those SCS assets. This involves assessing the current pipeline, filling it with new business opportunities and improving our overall competitive position. To achieve this you will work in close collaboration with both CDMO and Operations teams.

Key responsibilities:

  • Continuously monitor and analyze the global biotechnology market and identify new business opportunities including new trends, growth areas, customers, products and services
  • Understand the needs of the industry and respective companies, seek out the appropriate contacts in new organizations, generate new leads and cold call prospective customers
  • Full project accountability from the first customer contact, via inquiry and contract negotiations,  until completion of the commercial manufacturing agreement
  • Close cross-functional cooperation during project acquisition and execution with the business unit, R&D, production, sourcing, legal and other departments
  • Customer account planning and sales reporting
  • Support the business strategy by developing a portfolio of customers and a healthy project pipeline
  • Represent SCS at international conferences and trade shows   
  • Satisfy the needs of your customers with a high level of service and a continuous dialogue

Key requirements:

  • Strong network and experience in sales and new business development, sound understanding of new markets, growth areas, trends, customers, products and services in the biotechnological and/or chemical industry with focus on various business segments such as food, feed, nutrition, cosmetics, agricultural applications; understanding of red biotechnology is a plus
  • Background in industrial application of natural sciences (Biotech or Chemistry) in a CDMO type of company is a must
  • Ability to create new customer contact strategies
  • Excellent project management skills to support customers from early stage inquiries until commercial manufacturing
  • Creative, convincing, proactive in building and maintaining strong and trustful customer relationships
  • Act with high sense of urgency, strong in working autonomously and team collaboration skills
  • Fluent English, German is a plus
  • Willingness for traveling approximately 20%
     

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

job.title: Medical Science Liaison Manager - Cardiovascular (f/m)
job.plaincontent:
Sanofi ist ein weltweites Gesundheitsunternehmen, das Menschen bei ihren gesundheitlichen Herausforderungen unterstützt. Mit unseren Impfstoffen beugen wir Erkrankungen vor. Mit innovativen Arzneimitteln lindern wir ihre Schmerzen und Leiden. Wir kümmern uns gleichermaßen um Menschen mit seltenen Erkrankungen wie um die Millionen von Menschen mit einer chronischen Erkrankung.
Mit mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeitern in 100 Ländern weltweit übersetzen wir wissenschaftliche Innovation in medizinischen Fortschritt.
Sanofi, Empowering Life.

job.title: Assistant Manager - US Accounting and Reporting Group USARG
job.plaincontent:
Assistant Manager - US Accounting and Reporting Group USARG
Zurich By arrangement 100% Would you like to participate in audits for some of the biggest multinational companies in the world and top KPMG Global clients? Our US Accounting and Reporting Group (USARG) is actively looking for highly motivated individuals to join their team.Zurich By arrangement 100%
Apply later
Would you like to apply? Send yourself this vacancy by e-mail and apply from the comfort of your home.
The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.
Send linkApply now
Responsibilities & Profile
Your contribution to KPMG
- Conduct integrated audits of multinational companies or Swiss subsidiaries of U.S. companies including reporting to KPMG U.S. and other group auditors - Audit spin-offs, disposals, opening balance sheets and acquired businesses in connection with various business combinations - Support and lead other transaction based projects that require US GAAP and SEC reporting expertise (comfort letters, agreed-upon procedures and reviews of registration statements) - Process financial statement conversions to US GAAP - Deliver accounting advisory and SOX advisory services to non-audit clients - Coach Swiss-based audit teams on technical US accounting, auditing and reporting inquiries - Conduct internal and external US GAAP and US GAAS training
This is what makes you successful
- Strong knowledge of US GAAP, US GAAS/PCAOB and SEC requirements and US audit methodology - Minimum 3-4 years of recent integrated (SOX and US GAAP/PCAOB) audit experience either with KPMG or another Big 4 firm and proficiency in researching accounting and auditing issues - U.S. CPA license (or equivalent) - Strong project management skills - Ability to deliver high quality services under tight deadlines - Highly motivated, curious and proactive team player with a positive attitude - Proficient English skills, German skills are a big plus
Clarity on Dynamic Audit
Your advantages at KPMG
Empowered to lead
Responsibility from day one. That’s how we empower tomorrow’s business leaders at KPMG. You value your independence – and so do we. We cultivate an environment where you can unfold your potential.
Your personal skillset
From digital learning to external programs, personal development comes in many shapes and forms at KPMG. Share our passion for learning and cultivate future and digital skills that will last a lifetime. Even better: benefit from our contribution to the cost of qualifying in your field.
Inspired to innovate
As part of KPMG, you join other highly qualified and motivated professionals in an inspiring entrepreneurial environment. A clear mindset and strong opinions are not only encouraged at KPMG, but expected. When it comes to ideas, quality beats hierarchy.
New ventures
KPMG thrives – and depends – on agility and change. Help shape the next generation of business with your open mindset and entrepreneurial spirit. We constantly create room for your ideas to unfold.
Choose your path
KPMG career paths are as diverse as our people. Thrive in our culture of collaboration, mentoring and mobility opportunities. As your interests and skills evolve, personal development talks guide you to the next level.
All inclusive
You expect fair compensation and certified equal pay. At KPMG, that’s what you get. Our inclusive culture makes space for unconventional ideas and new ways of working. New mothers and fathers benefit from our generous packages.
Connections that count
With our culture of collaboration, you'll automatically develop valuable and lasting links to colleagues and clients. Strengthen crucial connections further at in-house and external networking and social events.
Substance and style
Value variety in your working day and thrive at KPMG. Our multidisciplinary teams collaborate to deliver real results - across borders, sectors and service lines.
Ancillary benefits may apply to certain positions (e.g. fixed-contract positions).
Your salary in this position will be in line with industry standards and will depend on your professional experience and education. During the recruitment process we will negotiate your salary with you according to our guidelines. Any salary ranges published on external platforms for this position have not been agreed with KPMG and do not apply.
KPMG as an employer
Your future team
A position in the USARG will allow you to gain valuable experience in technical accounting and auditing areas in a dynamic international setting. If you are eager to broaden your experience and improve your skill set and résumé, we can offer you opportunities to realize your full potential. Benefit from our comprehensive training both on and off the job as part of our ongoing technical and topical training curriculum, enabling new joiners at any level to increase proficiency in technical and commercial matters.More
About KPMG
KPMG is known for providing clear and consistent solutions in the areas of auditing and advisory services. The broad palette of services across many subject matters and industries allows the provision of multidisciplinary services from a single source for our clients on the one hand and diverse careers and development options for our employees on the other hand. Our dealings are fair and frank and we strive to always look at the results of our work through the eyes of our clients. At KPMG, we are aware that if we add value for our clients, we also do the same for ourselves.
Contact
Monique Schumaker
Human Resources +41 58 249 79 37 To apply for this vacancy, please provide your cover letter, CV and all relevant certificates. We look forward to receiving your application.

Zurich
By arrangement
100%
Would you like to participate in audits for some of the biggest multinational companies in the world and top KPMG Global clients? Our US Accounting and Reporting Group (USARG) is actively looking for highly motivated individuals to join their team.Zurich
By arrangement
100%

Apply later

The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.

Send linkApply now

Responsibilities & Profile

Your contribution to KPMG

  • Conduct integrated audits of multinational companies or Swiss subsidiaries of U.S. companies including reporting to KPMG U.S. and other group auditors
  • Audit spin-offs, disposals, opening balance sheets and acquired businesses in connection with various business combinations
  • Support and lead other transaction based projects that require US GAAP and SEC reporting expertise (comfort letters, agreed-upon procedures and reviews of registration statements)
  • Process financial statement conversions to US GAAP
  • Deliver accounting advisory and SOX advisory services to non-audit clients
  • Coach Swiss-based audit teams on technical US accounting, auditing and reporting inquiries
  • Conduct internal and external US GAAP and US GAAS training

This is what makes you successful

  • Strong knowledge of US GAAP, US GAAS/PCAOB and SEC requirements and US audit methodology
  • Minimum 3-4 years of recent integrated (SOX and US GAAP/PCAOB) audit experience either with KPMG or another Big 4 firm and proficiency in researching accounting and auditing issues
  • U.S. CPA license (or equivalent)
  • Strong project management skills
  • Ability to deliver high quality services under tight deadlines
  • Highly motivated, curious and proactive team player with a positive attitude
  • Proficient English skills, German skills are a big plus

job.title: Senior Consultant or Assistant Manager - GMS
job.plaincontent:
Senior Consultant or Assistant Manager - GMS
Geneva As soon as possible 100% Do you want to work in a truly international environment? Do you want to be part of a young and dynamic team that is recognized as a global leader in what they do? Do you want to have diverse career opportunities? This is what you will be part of if you join KPMG's Global Mobility Services teamGeneva As soon as possible 100%
Apply later
Would you like to apply? Send yourself this vacancy by e-mail and apply from the comfort of your home.
The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.
Send linkApply now
Responsibilities & Profile
Your contribution to KPMG
- Advising clients on a wide range of Swiss tax issues including tax residence matters, cross-border tax implications, social security matters, taxable benefits and tax reconciliation processes - Preparing Swiss tax returns with international exposure, tax equalization calculations and tax projections for individuals - Managing a portfolio of approximately 150 individuals, conduct arrival and departure meetings with our internationally mobile private clients - Preparing and reviewing correspondence with tax authorities in relation to tax notices and/or audits for expatriates - Negotiation with the tax authorities regarding tax ruling, tax appeals and complex tax situation - Communicate with individual taxpayers and other KPMG offices, as well as HR and Payroll contacts at our corporate clients - For Assistant Manager grade, build strong relationships with our client's executives and act as a central point of contact for the Swiss local HR as well as for other KPMG offices on clients you will be responsible for
This is what makes you successful
- Master in Law or Business Law preferably with major in tax, or any related degree - A minimum of 3 years' experience in individual tax, with a Big 4 or consulting background in Switzerland - Solid experience in advising international clients - Fluent in French and in English. German is a plus - Dedication and motivation to achieve high standards of client service, excellent organizational skills and ability to work under tight deadlines, initiative - Be able to demonstrate team spirit and able to work in a multicultural environment - Analytically minded - Solution-orientated
Why KPMG
Your advantages at KPMG
Empowered to lead
Responsibility from day one. That’s how we empower tomorrow’s business leaders at KPMG. You value your independence – and so do we. We cultivate an environment where you can unfold your potential.
Your personal skillset
From digital learning to external programs, personal development comes in many shapes and forms at KPMG. Share our passion for learning and cultivate future and digital skills that will last a lifetime. Even better: benefit from our contribution to the cost of qualifying in your field.
Inspired to innovate
As part of KPMG, you join other highly qualified and motivated professionals in an inspiring entrepreneurial environment. A clear mindset and strong opinions are not only encouraged at KPMG, but expected. When it comes to ideas, quality beats hierarchy.
New ventures
KPMG thrives – and depends – on agility and change. Help shape the next generation of business with your open mindset and entrepreneurial spirit. We constantly create room for your ideas to unfold.
Choose your path
KPMG career paths are as diverse as our people. Thrive in our culture of collaboration, mentoring and mobility opportunities. As your interests and skills evolve, personal development talks guide you to the next level.
All inclusive
You expect fair compensation and certified equal pay. At KPMG, that’s what you get. Our inclusive culture makes space for unconventional ideas and new ways of working. New mothers and fathers benefit from our generous packages.
Connections that count
With our culture of collaboration, you'll automatically develop valuable and lasting links to colleagues and clients. Strengthen crucial connections further at in-house and external networking and social events.
Substance and style
Value variety in your working day and thrive at KPMG. Our multidisciplinary teams collaborate to deliver real results - across borders, sectors and service lines.
Ancillary benefits may apply to certain positions (e.g. fixed-contract positions).
Your salary in this position will be in line with industry standards and will depend on your professional experience and education. During the recruitment process we will negotiate your salary with you according to our guidelines. Any salary ranges published on external platforms for this position have not been agreed with KPMG and do not apply.
KPMG as an employer
Your future team
Global Mobility is about companies moving their employees around the world. This gives rise to all sorts of considerations, including how these mobile people are taxed, what is the best way to structure compensation and assets and how the individuals and their employer comply with the various income tax and social security laws in force around the world. KPMG's GMS team focusses on all aspects of mobility including tax compliance and advisory and providing support to our clients' HR and Tax teams.More
About KPMG
KPMG is known for providing clear and consistent solutions in the areas of auditing and advisory services. The broad palette of services across many subject matters and industries allows the provision of multidisciplinary services from a single source for our clients on the one hand and diverse careers and development options for our employees on the other hand. Our dealings are fair and frank and we strive to always look at the results of our work through the eyes of our clients. At KPMG, we are aware that if we add value for our clients, we also do the same for ourselves.
Contact
Capucine Foessel
Human Resources +41 58 249 46 71 To apply for this vacancy, please provide your cover letter, CV and all relevant certificates. We look forward to receiving your application.

job.htmlcontent:
Senior Consultant or Assistant Manager - GMS

Geneva
As soon as possible
100%
Do you want to work in a truly international environment? Do you want to be part of a young and dynamic team that is recognized as a global leader in what they do? Do you want to have diverse career opportunities? This is what you will be part of if you join KPMG's Global Mobility Services teamGeneva
As soon as possible
100%

Apply later

Would you like to apply? Send yourself this vacancy by e-mail and apply from the comfort of your home.

The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.

Send linkApply now

Responsibilities & Profile

Your contribution to KPMG

  • Advising clients on a wide range of Swiss tax issues including tax residence matters, cross-border tax implications, social security matters, taxable benefits and tax reconciliation processes
  • Preparing Swiss tax returns with international exposure, tax equalization calculations and tax projections for individuals
  • Managing a portfolio of approximately 150 individuals, conduct arrival and departure meetings with our internationally mobile private clients
  • Preparing and reviewing correspondence with tax authorities in relation to tax notices and/or audits for expatriates
  • Negotiation with the tax authorities regarding tax ruling, tax appeals and complex tax situation
  • Communicate with individual taxpayers and other KPMG offices, as well as HR and Payroll contacts at our corporate clients
  • For Assistant Manager grade, build strong relationships with our client's executives and act as a central point of contact for the Swiss local HR as well as for other KPMG offices on clients you will be responsible for

This is what makes you successful

  • Master in Law or Business Law preferably with major in tax, or any related degree
  • A minimum of 3 years' experience in individual tax, with a Big 4 or consulting background in Switzerland
  • Solid experience in advising international clients
  • Fluent in French and in English. German is a plus
  • Dedication and motivation to achieve high standards of client service, excellent organizational skills and ability to work under tight deadlines, initiative
  • Be able to demonstrate team spirit and able to work in a multicultural environment
  • Analytically minded
  • Solution-orientated

Why KPMG

Your advantages at KPMG

Empowered to lead

Responsibility from day one. That’s how we empower tomorrow’s business leaders at KPMG. You value your independence – and so do we. We cultivate an environment where you can unfold your potential.

Inspired to innovate

As part of KPMG, you join other highly qualified and motivated professionals in an inspiring entrepreneurial environment. A clear mindset and strong opinions are not only encouraged at KPMG, but expected. When it comes to ideas, quality beats hierarchy.

New ventures

KPMG thrives – and depends – on agility and change. Help shape the next generation of business with your open mindset and entrepreneurial spirit. We constantly create room for your ideas to unfold.

Choose your path

KPMG career paths are as diverse as our people. Thrive in our culture of collaboration, mentoring and mobility opportunities. As your interests and skills evolve, personal development talks guide you to the next level.

All inclusive

You expect fair compensation and certified equal pay. At KPMG, that’s what you get. Our inclusive culture makes space for unconventional ideas and new ways of working. New mothers and fathers benefit from our generous packages.

Connections that count

With our culture of collaboration, you'll automatically develop valuable and lasting links to colleagues and clients. Strengthen crucial connections further at in-house and external networking and social events.

Substance and style

Value variety in your working day and thrive at KPMG. Our multidisciplinary teams collaborate to deliver real results - across borders, sectors and service lines.

Ancillary benefits may apply to certain positions (e.g. fixed-contract positions).

Your salary in this position will be in line with industry standards and will depend on your professional experience and education. During the recruitment process we will negotiate your salary with you according to our guidelines. Any salary ranges published on external platforms for this position have not been agreed with KPMG and do not apply.

KPMG as an employer

Your future team

Global Mobility is about companies moving their employees around the world. This gives rise to all sorts of considerations, including how these mobile people are taxed, what is the best way to structure compensation and assets and how the individuals and their employer comply with the various income tax and social security laws in force around the world. KPMG's GMS team focusses on all aspects of mobility including tax compliance and advisory and providing support to our clients' HR and Tax teams.More

About KPMG

KPMG is known for providing clear and consistent solutions in the areas of auditing and advisory services. The broad palette of services across many subject matters and industries allows the provision of multidisciplinary services from a single source for our clients on the one hand and diverse careers and development options for our employees on the other hand. Our dealings are fair and frank and we strive to always look at the results of our work through the eyes of our clients. At KPMG, we are aware that if we add value for our clients, we also do the same for ourselves.

Your contribution to KPMG

This is what makes you successful
- Bachelor or Master Degree in economics or business informatics; CISA certification is a strong plus - More than 4 years of professional experience in performing IT audits of ERP systems and business processes, preferably within a Big 4 environment - Experience in leading teams and coaching people - Well-founded risk & compliance knowledge and excellent understanding of technology trends and innovation (e.g. SAP HANA, robotics) - Flexible regarding working hours and location. Strong focus on clients and in finding the best/innovative solution for them - Communicative, motivated, solution oriented and client-focused personality - Advanced German and English skills are crucial for this role - Willing to travel domestically and abroad on client engagements

job.title: Manager - Financial Services IFRS Accounting Advisory
job.plaincontent:
Manager - Financial Services IFRS Accounting Advisory
Zürich Ab sofort 80-100% Du schätzt ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld, in welchem du sowohl intern unser Management, als auch extern unsere Kunden mit deinem IFRS Fachwissen unterstützt. Für unser IFRS Accounting Advisory Team suchen wir eine dienstleistungsorientierte Persönlichkeit mit ausgeprägtem Beratungsflair.Zürich Ab sofort 80-100%
Später bewerben
Möchtest du dich auf diese Stelle bewerben? Sende dir diese Stelle per E-Mail zu und bewirb dich bequem von zu Hause aus.
Der Link zu dieser Stelle wurde an die eingegebene E-Mail-Adresse verschickt.
Link sendenJetzt bewerben
Aufgaben & Profil
So bringst du KPMG weiter
- Berate unsere Kunden bei der Einführung und Anwendung von neuen IFRS Standards, sowie der bilanziellen Abbildung von Spezialfällen - Unterstütze lokale CFOs aktiv bei der erstmaligen Umsetzung neuer Rechnungslegungsvorschriften - Analysiere komplexe Fragestellungen und beantworte technische Anfragen - Überprüfe Jahresabschlüsse auf die Einhaltung der anwendbaren IFRS - Führe interne und externe Schulungen durch und gebe dein Fachwissen bei Veranstaltungen an unsere Kunden weiter - Pflege bestehende Kundenbeziehungen und Unterstütze bei der Akquirierung von neuen Kunden und Accounting Advisory Mandaten
Deshalb bist du erfolgreich
- Bachelor oder Master, ergänzt mit einer Zusatzausbildung (z.B. dipl. Wirtschaftsprüfer, CPA, ACCA) - Ausgewiesene Berufserfahrung im IFRS Umfeld und in der Implementierung neuer Standards, einschlägige IFRS 9 oder 17 Erfahrung ist ein Plus - Beratungserfahrung mit Fokus auf Finanz- oder Versicherungsinstitute, Big 4 ist ein Plus - Sehr gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch - Freude an der Ausarbeitung von Lösungen bei komplexen Fragestellungen - Engagierte, überzeugende und unternehmerisch denkende Persönlichkeit, die aktiv auf Kunden zugehen kann - Strukturierte und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise
Clarity on KPMG Switzerland
Deine Vorteile bei KPMG
Verantwortung ab Tag 1
Bei KPMG übernimmst du vom ersten Tag an Verantwortung. Dadurch befähigen wir die Führungskräfte von morgen. Du schätzt deine Eigenständigkeit – wir auch. Wir pflegen ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du dein gesamtes Potenzial entfalten kannst.
Deine persönlichen Kompetenzen
Von digitalen Lernangeboten zu externen Trainings: Wir bieten dir zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, dich fachlich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an deinen Fähigkeiten für die Zukunft – ob soft oder hard skills, ob analoge oder digitale skills. Noch besser: wir unterstützen dich auch finanziell bei deiner Weiterbildung.
Zu Innovationen inspiriert
Bei KPMG triffst du auf hochqualifizierte, ambitionierte Experten. Du arbeitest in einem inspirierenden Umfeld, in dem eine strukturierte Denkweise und starke Meinungen nicht nur gefördert, sondern vorausgesetzt werden. Denn wir glauben daran, dass bei Ideen Qualität vor Hierarchie kommt.
Auf zu neuen Ufern
Agilität und Veränderung machen den Erfolg von KPMG aus. Gestalte mit deiner Aufgeschlossenheit und deinem Unternehmergeist die nächste Wirtschaftsgeneration mit. Wir schaffen dir Raum, deine Ideen zu verwirklichen.
Wähle deinen Weg
Karrierewege sind bei KPMG so verschieden wie unsere Mitarbeitenden. Unsere Kultur der Zusammenarbeit, des Mentorings und der Mobilität lässt dich aufblühen. Du kannst deine Interessen und Fähigkeiten entfalten – und erreichst durch persönliche Entwicklungsgespräche deine nächsten Karriereziele.
Alles inklusive
Du erwartest einen fairen, marktgerechten Lohn. Das ist bei KPMG selbstverständlich. Unsere inkludierende Firmenkultur bietet Raum für unkonventionelle Ideen und neue Arbeitsweisen. Mütter und Väter profitieren von unseren grosszügigen Packages.
Wertvolle Beziehungen
Durch unsere Kultur der Zusammenarbeit knüpfst du wertvolle und anhaltende Beziehungen zu deinen Kolleginnen, Kollegen und Kunden. Diese Kontakte kannst du bei unseren internen und externen Networking- und Team-Events festigen.
Substanz und Stil
Schätze die Abwechslung in deinem Arbeitsalltag und lerne jeden Tag dazu. Unsere fachübergreifenden Teams arbeiten eng zusammen, um ihre anspruchsvollen Ziele zu erreichen - über Grenzen, Branchen und Dienstleistungen hinweg.
Für einzelne Stellen (z.B. befristete Anstellungen) können abweichende Benefits gelten.
Dein Salär in dieser Position wird branchenüblich sein und richtet sich u.a. nach deiner Berufserfahrung und deiner Ausbildung. Im Verlaufe des Rekrutierungsprozesses werden wir deinen Lohn gemäss unseren Richtlinien mit dir festlegen. Allfällige auf externen Plattformen publizierte Lohnspannen für diese Position sind nicht mit KPMG abgesprochen und haben keine Gültigkeit.
KPMG als Arbeitgeber
Dein zukünftiges Team
Der Bereich Financial Services Accounting Advisory ist Teil der Unternehmenssparte Financial Services und ist darauf spezialisiert, unsere Kunden mit massgeschneiderten Lösungen auf den Gebieten IFRS, Rechnungslegung für Banken und Versicherungen sowie Schweizer Obligationenrecht zu unterstützen. Es erwarten dich vielseitige Karrieremöglichkeiten und herausfordernde Tätigkeiten. Deine Teamkollegen sind jung, dynamisch und bewegen sich in einem internationalen Umfeld.Mehr
Über KPMG
KPMG ist bekannt für klare und konsistente Lösungen in den Bereichen Wirtschaftsprüfung, Steuer- und Unternehmensberatung. Die breite Aufstellung über viele Fachdisziplinen und Branchen hinweg ermöglicht multidisziplinäre Dienstleistungen aus einer Hand für unsere Kunden und diverse Karriere- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten für unsere Mitarbeitenden. Wir pflegen einen offenen und ehrlichen Umgang und sind bestrebt, die Ergebnisse unserer Arbeit stets mit den Augen der Kunden zu sehen. Für KPMG ist klar: Indem wir für unsere Kunden Mehrwert schaffen, tun wir dies auch für uns selbst.
Ansprechpartner
Christos Makridis
Human Resources +41 58 249 26 30 Bitte reiche für diese Stelle dein Motivationsschreiben, deinen Lebenslauf und alle relevanten Zeugnisse ein. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.
Weitere Stellen

Apprenti(e) employé(e) de commerce - Audit Corporate
Audit · Neuenburg Mehr erfahren

Financial Services · Zürich Mehr erfahrenRechtlicher HinweisDatenschutzBarrierefreiheitSitemapHilfeKontaktGlossar

Der Link zu dieser Stelle wurde an die eingegebene E-Mail-Adresse verschickt.

Link sendenJetzt bewerben

Aufgaben & Profil

So bringst du KPMG weiter

  • Berate unsere Kunden bei der Einführung und Anwendung von neuen IFRS Standards, sowie der bilanziellen Abbildung von Spezialfällen
  • Unterstütze lokale CFOs aktiv bei der erstmaligen Umsetzung neuer Rechnungslegungsvorschriften
  • Analysiere komplexe Fragestellungen und beantworte technische Anfragen
  • Überprüfe Jahresabschlüsse auf die Einhaltung der anwendbaren IFRS
  • Führe interne und externe Schulungen durch und gebe dein Fachwissen bei Veranstaltungen an unsere Kunden weiter
  • Pflege bestehende Kundenbeziehungen und Unterstütze bei der Akquirierung von neuen Kunden und Accounting Advisory Mandaten

Deshalb bist du erfolgreich

  • Bachelor oder Master, ergänzt mit einer Zusatzausbildung (z.B. dipl. Wirtschaftsprüfer, CPA, ACCA)
  • Ausgewiesene Berufserfahrung im IFRS Umfeld und in der Implementierung neuer Standards, einschlägige IFRS 9 oder 17 Erfahrung ist ein Plus
  • Beratungserfahrung mit Fokus auf Finanz- oder Versicherungsinstitute, Big 4 ist ein Plus
  • Sehr gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch
  • Freude an der Ausarbeitung von Lösungen bei komplexen Fragestellungen
  • Engagierte, überzeugende und unternehmerisch denkende Persönlichkeit, die aktiv auf Kunden zugehen kann
  • Strukturierte und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise

Clarity on KPMG Switzerland

Deine Vorteile bei KPMG

Verantwortung ab Tag 1

Bei KPMG übernimmst du vom ersten Tag an Verantwortung. Dadurch befähigen wir die Führungskräfte von morgen. Du schätzt deine Eigenständigkeit – wir auch. Wir pflegen ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du dein gesamtes Potenzial entfalten kannst.

Deine persönlichen Kompetenzen

Von digitalen Lernangeboten zu externen Trainings: Wir bieten dir zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, dich fachlich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an deinen Fähigkeiten für die Zukunft – ob soft oder hard skills, ob analoge oder digitale skills. Noch besser: wir unterstützen dich auch finanziell bei deiner Weiterbildung.

Zu Innovationen inspiriert

Bei KPMG triffst du auf hochqualifizierte, ambitionierte Experten. Du arbeitest in einem inspirierenden Umfeld, in dem eine strukturierte Denkweise und starke Meinungen nicht nur gefördert, sondern vorausgesetzt werden. Denn wir glauben daran, dass bei Ideen Qualität vor Hierarchie kommt.

Auf zu neuen Ufern

Agilität und Veränderung machen den Erfolg von KPMG aus. Gestalte mit deiner Aufgeschlossenheit und deinem Unternehmergeist die nächste Wirtschaftsgeneration mit. Wir schaffen dir Raum, deine Ideen zu verwirklichen.

Wähle deinen Weg

Karrierewege sind bei KPMG so verschieden wie unsere Mitarbeitenden. Unsere Kultur der Zusammenarbeit, des Mentorings und der Mobilität lässt dich aufblühen. Du kannst deine Interessen und Fähigkeiten entfalten – und erreichst durch persönliche Entwicklungsgespräche deine nächsten Karriereziele.

Alles inklusive

Du erwartest einen fairen, marktgerechten Lohn. Das ist bei KPMG selbstverständlich. Unsere inkludierende Firmenkultur bietet Raum für unkonventionelle Ideen und neue Arbeitsweisen. Mütter und Väter profitieren von unseren grosszügigen Packages.

Wertvolle Beziehungen

Durch unsere Kultur der Zusammenarbeit knüpfst du wertvolle und anhaltende Beziehungen zu deinen Kolleginnen, Kollegen und Kunden. Diese Kontakte kannst du bei unseren internen und externen Networking- und Team-Events festigen.

Substanz und Stil

Schätze die Abwechslung in deinem Arbeitsalltag und lerne jeden Tag dazu. Unsere fachübergreifenden Teams arbeiten eng zusammen, um ihre anspruchsvollen Ziele zu erreichen - über Grenzen, Branchen und Dienstleistungen hinweg.

Für einzelne Stellen (z.B. befristete Anstellungen) können abweichende Benefits gelten.

Dein Salär in dieser Position wird branchenüblich sein und richtet sich u.a. nach deiner Berufserfahrung und deiner Ausbildung. Im Verlaufe des Rekrutierungsprozesses werden wir deinen Lohn gemäss unseren Richtlinien mit dir festlegen. Allfällige auf externen Plattformen publizierte Lohnspannen für diese Position sind nicht mit KPMG abgesprochen und haben keine Gültigkeit.

KPMG als Arbeitgeber

Dein zukünftiges Team

Der Bereich Financial Services Accounting Advisory ist Teil der Unternehmenssparte Financial Services und ist darauf spezialisiert, unsere Kunden mit massgeschneiderten Lösungen auf den Gebieten IFRS, Rechnungslegung für Banken und Versicherungen sowie Schweizer Obligationenrecht zu unterstützen. Es erwarten dich vielseitige Karrieremöglichkeiten und herausfordernde Tätigkeiten. Deine Teamkollegen sind jung, dynamisch und bewegen sich in einem internationalen Umfeld.Mehr

Über KPMG

KPMG ist bekannt für klare und konsistente Lösungen in den Bereichen Wirtschaftsprüfung, Steuer- und Unternehmensberatung. Die breite Aufstellung über viele Fachdisziplinen und Branchen hinweg ermöglicht multidisziplinäre Dienstleistungen aus einer Hand für unsere Kunden und diverse Karriere- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten für unsere Mitarbeitenden. Wir pflegen einen offenen und ehrlichen Umgang und sind bestrebt, die Ergebnisse unserer Arbeit stets mit den Augen der Kunden zu sehen. Für KPMG ist klar: Indem wir für unsere Kunden Mehrwert schaffen, tun wir dies auch für uns selbst.

Ansprechpartner

Christos Makridis

Human Resources
+41 58 249 26 30 Bitte reiche für diese Stelle dein Motivationsschreiben, deinen Lebenslauf und alle relevanten Zeugnisse ein. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.

job.title: Consultant or Senior Consultant - Forensic Technology
job.plaincontent:
Consultant or Senior Consultant - Forensic Technology
Geneva As soon as possible 100% Our Forensic Technology team is involved in cyber incident response and data leakage, computer crime and white-collar crime investigations in order to help organizations manage their risk and minimize the potential damage arising from misconduct.Geneva As soon as possible 100%
Apply later
Would you like to apply? Send yourself this vacancy by e-mail and apply from the comfort of your home.
The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.
Send linkApply now
Responsibilities & Profile
Your contribution to KPMG
- Perform IT Forensic tasks, such as securing data, gathering evidence, evaluations and documentations at the clients' location or at our offices - Select, secure, evaluate and interpret complex structured data sets drawn from various data sources and IT systems of different brands, using specialized tools and state of the art techniques - Identify and collect large volumes of e-mail, chat and other non-structured data as well as mobile devices, SIM cards, IoT, USB devices, hard-disks, etc. - Prepare data of sources and make it available for searching and reviewing by investigative and legal teams - Apply advanced visualization techniques, machine learning and predictive coding algorithms to get faster and better insights in the collected data - Summarize results from analyses, prepare recommendations based on these and write reports to support investigations - Assist with keeping our advanced Forensic Labs up to date with the newest technologies and implement and develop new tools as required - Develop, implement and maintain reliable mobile infrastructure solutions at client side and in our forensic Labs
This is what makes you successful
- Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with a major in Computer Science - Good understanding of hardware components and technologies (processors, bus systems, storage components) and broad knowledge of computer network technologies (components, protocols, network) - Experience in virtualization solutions (HyperV, ESX) - Good knowledge of Microsoft operating systems - Experience with one or several of the following programming languages: C++, Java, Python, Ruby, SQL - Fluent French or German, good English skills - Sense of responsibility and discretion, able to work with highly confidential and sensitive data, ability to work under pressure, flexibility to travel, diligence and eye for detail, a sense of perseverance and assertiveness, as well as creativity and good team work
Clarity on KPMG Switzerland
Your advantages at KPMG
Empowered to lead
Responsibility from day one. That’s how we empower tomorrow’s business leaders at KPMG. You value your independence – and so do we. We cultivate an environment where you can unfold your potential.
Your personal skillset
From digital learning to external programs, personal development comes in many shapes and forms at KPMG. Share our passion for learning and cultivate future and digital skills that will last a lifetime. Even better: benefit from our contribution to the cost of qualifying in your field.
Inspired to innovate
As part of KPMG, you join other highly qualified and motivated professionals in an inspiring entrepreneurial environment. A clear mindset and strong opinions are not only encouraged at KPMG, but expected. When it comes to ideas, quality beats hierarchy.
New ventures
KPMG thrives – and depends – on agility and change. Help shape the next generation of business with your open mindset and entrepreneurial spirit. We constantly create room for your ideas to unfold.
Choose your path
KPMG career paths are as diverse as our people. Thrive in our culture of collaboration, mentoring and mobility opportunities. As your interests and skills evolve, personal development talks guide you to the next level.
All inclusive
You expect fair compensation and certified equal pay. At KPMG, that’s what you get. Our inclusive culture makes space for unconventional ideas and new ways of working. New mothers and fathers benefit from our generous packages.
You're welcome
Build your KPMG career on a solid foundation. All new joiners attend our Welcome Day and benefit from tailored onboarding by dedicated colleagues as well as networking opportunities from day one.
Connections that count
With our culture of collaboration, you'll automatically develop valuable and lasting links to colleagues and clients. Strengthen crucial connections further at in-house and external networking and social events.
Ancillary benefits may apply to certain positions (e.g. fixed-contract positions).
Your salary in this position will be in line with industry standards and will depend on your professional experience and education. During the recruitment process we will negotiate your salary with you according to our guidelines. Any salary ranges published on external platforms for this position have not been agreed with KPMG and do not apply.
KPMG as an employer
Your future team
We provide a dynamic work environment that is fast-paced and often reactive to the needs of our clients. We are flexible, responsive, and above all committed to the quality and integrity of our work. As a new joiner to the team, you will experience dedicated colleagues to ensure your development and success on every project. You will be encouraged to think independently and provide creative ideas and solutions to increase the quality of our overall service. Our attractive Forensic client portfolio will ensure that no day will be the same, making this a fascinating position.More
About KPMG
KPMG is known for providing clear and consistent solutions in the areas of auditing and advisory services. The broad palette of services across many subject matters and industries allows the provision of multidisciplinary services from a single source for our clients on the one hand and diverse careers and development options for our employees on the other hand. Our dealings are fair and frank and we strive to always look at the results of our work through the eyes of our clients. At KPMG, we are aware that if we add value for our clients, we also do the same for ourselves.
Contact
Capucine Foessel
Human Resources +41 58 249 46 71 To apply for this vacancy, please provide your cover letter, CV and all relevant certificates. We look forward to receiving your application.

job.htmlcontent:
Consultant or Senior Consultant - Forensic Technology

Geneva
As soon as possible
100%
Our Forensic Technology team is involved in cyber incident response and data leakage, computer crime and white-collar crime investigations in order to help organizations manage their risk and minimize the potential damage arising from misconduct.Geneva
As soon as possible
100%

Apply later

Would you like to apply? Send yourself this vacancy by e-mail and apply from the comfort of your home.

The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.

Send linkApply now

Responsibilities & Profile

Your contribution to KPMG

  • Perform IT Forensic tasks, such as securing data, gathering evidence, evaluations and documentations at the clients' location or at our offices
  • Select, secure, evaluate and interpret complex structured data sets drawn from various data sources and IT systems of different brands, using specialized tools and state of the art techniques
  • Identify and collect large volumes of e-mail, chat and other non-structured data as well as mobile devices, SIM cards, IoT, USB devices, hard-disks, etc.
  • Prepare data of sources and make it available for searching and reviewing by investigative and legal teams
  • Apply advanced visualization techniques, machine learning and predictive coding algorithms to get faster and better insights in the collected data
  • Summarize results from analyses, prepare recommendations based on these and write reports to support investigations
  • Assist with keeping our advanced Forensic Labs up to date with the newest technologies and implement and develop new tools as required
  • Develop, implement and maintain reliable mobile infrastructure solutions at client side and in our forensic Labs

This is what makes you successful

  • Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with a major in Computer Science
  • Good understanding of hardware components and technologies (processors, bus systems, storage components) and broad knowledge of computer network technologies (components, protocols, network)
  • Experience in virtualization solutions (HyperV, ESX)
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft operating systems
  • Experience with one or several of the following programming languages: C++, Java, Python, Ruby, SQL
  • Fluent French or German, good English skills
  • Sense of responsibility and discretion, able to work with highly confidential and sensitive data, ability to work under pressure, flexibility to travel, diligence and eye for detail, a sense of perseverance and assertiveness, as well as creativity and good team work

Clarity on KPMG Switzerland

Your advantages at KPMG

Empowered to lead

Responsibility from day one. That’s how we empower tomorrow’s business leaders at KPMG. You value your independence – and so do we. We cultivate an environment where you can unfold your potential.

Your personal skillset

From digital learning to external programs, personal development comes in many shapes and forms at KPMG. Share our passion for learning and cultivate future and digital skills that will last a lifetime. Even better: benefit from our contribution to the cost of qualifying in your field.

Inspired to innovate

As part of KPMG, you join other highly qualified and motivated professionals in an inspiring entrepreneurial environment. A clear mindset and strong opinions are not only encouraged at KPMG, but expected. When it comes to ideas, quality beats hierarchy.

New ventures

KPMG thrives – and depends – on agility and change. Help shape the next generation of business with your open mindset and entrepreneurial spirit. We constantly create room for your ideas to unfold.

Choose your path

KPMG career paths are as diverse as our people. Thrive in our culture of collaboration, mentoring and mobility opportunities. As your interests and skills evolve, personal development talks guide you to the next level.

All inclusive

You expect fair compensation and certified equal pay. At KPMG, that’s what you get. Our inclusive culture makes space for unconventional ideas and new ways of working. New mothers and fathers benefit from our generous packages.

You're welcome

Build your KPMG career on a solid foundation. All new joiners attend our Welcome Day and benefit from tailored onboarding by dedicated colleagues as well as networking opportunities from day one.

Connections that count

With our culture of collaboration, you'll automatically develop valuable and lasting links to colleagues and clients. Strengthen crucial connections further at in-house and external networking and social events.

Ancillary benefits may apply to certain positions (e.g. fixed-contract positions).

Your salary in this position will be in line with industry standards and will depend on your professional experience and education. During the recruitment process we will negotiate your salary with you according to our guidelines. Any salary ranges published on external platforms for this position have not been agreed with KPMG and do not apply.

KPMG as an employer

Your future team

We provide a dynamic work environment that is fast-paced and often reactive to the needs of our clients. We are flexible, responsive, and above all committed to the quality and integrity of our work. As a new joiner to the team, you will experience dedicated colleagues to ensure your development and success on every project. You will be encouraged to think independently and provide creative ideas and solutions to increase the quality of our overall service. Our attractive Forensic client portfolio will ensure that no day will be the same, making this a fascinating position.More

About KPMG

KPMG is known for providing clear and consistent solutions in the areas of auditing and advisory services. The broad palette of services across many subject matters and industries allows the provision of multidisciplinary services from a single source for our clients on the one hand and diverse careers and development options for our employees on the other hand. Our dealings are fair and frank and we strive to always look at the results of our work through the eyes of our clients. At KPMG, we are aware that if we add value for our clients, we also do the same for ourselves.

Contact

Capucine Foessel

Human Resources
+41 58 249 46 71 To apply for this vacancy, please provide your cover letter, CV and all relevant certificates. We look forward to receiving your application.

job.title: Senior Consultant - Banking Strategy & Transformation
job.plaincontent:
Senior Consultant - Banking Strategy & Transformation
Zurich As soon as possible 100% Advise our clients in this transformative phase of the financial industry and lead complex strategic projects confidently to success.Zurich As soon as possible 100%
Apply later
Would you like to apply? Send yourself this vacancy by e-mail and apply from the comfort of your home.
The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.
Send linkApply now
Responsibilities & Profile
Your contribution to KPMG
- Advise clients on strategic projects in a challenging and rapidly changing environment - Adapt business and operating models with regards to organizational, process and technology related aspects - Work with our experienced and multidisciplinary team together with the client in a global environment - Show entrepreneurial mindset and develop new business ideas - Put your talents to use and drive innovation
This is what makes you successful
- Bachelor's degree and very good academic record required; master's degree typically preferred - Banking Industry and/or consulting experience - Good understanding of technology-related aspects (e.g. digitalization) and technical skills - Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills - Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and with people at all levels in an organization - Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and preferably in German

Local office training, daily exchange with experts and exam support from people who've been there - little extras make a big difference in kick-starting your career at KPMG.
Ancillary benefits may apply to certain positions (e.g. fixed-contract positions).
Your salary in this position will be in line with industry standards and will depend on your professional experience and education. During the recruitment process we will negotiate your salary with you according to our guidelines. Any salary ranges published on external platforms for this position have not been agreed with KPMG and do not apply.
KPMG as an employer
Your future team
Our Banking Strategy & Transformation team advises clients on strategic initiatives and has a strong track record with regards to the transformation of the bank's business and operating models. As of today, the team is helping both, large and mid-size banks on their challenging journey and covers business, technical and regulatory aspects. We follow a multidisciplinary approach and collaborate with the KPMG network to serve our banks globally.More

KPMG is known for providing clear and consistent solutions in the areas of auditing and advisory services. The broad palette of services across many subject matters and industries allows the provision of multidisciplinary services from a single source for our clients on the one hand and diverse careers and development options for our employees on the other hand. job.title: Technology (Sr.)Consultant - Finance Strategy & Transformation
job.plaincontent:
Technology (Sr.)Consultant - Finance Strategy & Transformation
Zurich By arrangement 80-100% We are looking for a Technology Consultant or Senior Technology Consultant to help implement innovative technology solutions across our clients Finance functions. Your tasks will primarily focus around learning to build prototypes across a variety of technologies and adapting them to a client context.Zurich By arrangement 80-100%
Apply later
Would you like to apply? Send yourself this vacancy by e-mail and apply from the comfort of your home.
The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.
Send linkApply now
Responsibilities & Profile
Your contribution to KPMG
- Together with our team, you will create prototypes and solutions on various new technologies covering Robotic Process Automation, Chatbots and machine learning - Deliver solutions to improve processes, systems and organizational set-up for Finance, Controlling and Accounting functions - Work in a dynamic environment delivering consulting services to national and international clients - Help our clients to improve the timeliness and quality of their processes e.g. reporting, planning and forecasting processes - Streamline large amounts of data to support CFOs and their Finance functions with data management activities - Support proposals for the acquisition of new engagements with national and international clients Collaborate in cross-functional projects, working together as one team to deliver broader value to our clients - Benefit from the opportunity to participate in project-related work in another Management Consulting Team
This is what makes you successful
- Master Degree in IT, Computer Sciences, Engineering or similar - 1-2 years of professional working experience with technologies such as RPA (e.g. Blue Prism, UiPath, Automation Anywhere), Chatbots (e.g. boost.ai, Microsoft speech studio) is preferred - Experience in a corporate or business environment is preferred - Good computer programming skills (e.g. Java, SQL, Python) - Strong capabilities in MS Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Access) and automation (VBA, SQL); Awareness of ERP system functionalities (SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, etc.) is a plus - Ability to deal with large amounts of data and understanding of management information systems - Fluent and strong verbal communication skills in English; German is a plus
Dare to break new ground

Responsibility from day one. That’s how we empower tomorrow’s business leaders at KPMG. You value your independence – and so do we. We cultivate an environment where you can unfold your potential.

All inclusive

Added extras
High performance people need a top IT infrastructure and excellent mobility - and not just at work. We pay for your cell phone package and a half fare rail card, and let you borrow our company cars and bikes.
Connections that count
With our culture of collaboration, you'll automatically develop valuable and lasting links to colleagues and clients. Strengthen crucial connections further at in-house and external networking and social events.

During the recruitment process we will negotiate your salary with you according to our guidelines. KPMG as an employer
Your future team
The Finance Strategy & Transformation team is a part of the Management Consulting Group, which supports clients with Finance & Controlling, Supply Chain, Procurement and IT challenges. We act as one team to provide end-to-end service offering and best value for our clients. As a member of the Finance Strategy & Transformation team, you will continue to develop your career in a dynamic, international environment. If you are eager to work closely with global clients and leverage your full potential, this is the right position for you.More

job.htmlcontent:
Technology (Sr.)Consultant - Finance Strategy & Transformation

Zurich
By arrangement
80-100%
We are looking for a Technology Consultant or Senior Technology Consultant to help implement innovative technology solutions across our clients Finance functions. Your tasks will primarily focus around learning to build prototypes across a variety of technologies and adapting them to a client context.Zurich
By arrangement
80-100%

Apply later

Would you like to apply? Send yourself this vacancy by e-mail and apply from the comfort of your home.

The link to this job has been sent to the email address provided.

Send linkApply now

Responsibilities & Profile

Your contribution to KPMG

  • Together with our team, you will create prototypes and solutions on various new technologies covering Robotic Process Automation, Chatbots and machine learning
  • Deliver solutions to improve processes, systems and organizational set-up for Finance, Controlling and Accounting functions
  • Work in a dynamic environment delivering consulting services to national and international clients
  • Help our clients to improve the timeliness and quality of their processes e.g. reporting, planning and forecasting processes
  • Streamline large amounts of data to support CFOs and their Finance functions with data management activities
  • Support proposals for the acquisition of new engagements with national and international clients Collaborate in cross-functional projects, working together as one team to deliver broader value to our clients
  • Benefit from the opportunity to participate in project-related work in another Management Consulting Team

This is what makes you successful

  • Master Degree in IT, Computer Sciences, Engineering or similar
  • 1-2 years of professional working experience with technologies such as RPA (e.g. Blue Prism, UiPath, Automation Anywhere), Chatbots (e.g. boost.ai, Microsoft speech studio) is preferred
  • Experience in a corporate or business environment is preferred
  • Good computer programming skills (e.g. Java, SQL, Python)
  • Strong capabilities in MS Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Access) and automation (VBA, SQL); Awareness of ERP system functionalities (SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, etc.) is a plus
  • Ability to deal with large amounts of data and understanding of management information systems
  • Fluent and strong verbal communication skills in English; German is a plus

Dare to break new ground

Your advantages at KPMG

Empowered to lead

All inclusive

You expect fair compensation and certified equal pay. At KPMG, that’s what you get. Our inclusive culture makes space for unconventional ideas and new ways of working. New mothers and fathers benefit from our generous packages.

Added extras

High performance people need a top IT infrastructure and excellent mobility - and not just at work. We pay for your cell phone package and a half fare rail card, and let you borrow our company cars and bikes.

With our culture of collaboration, you'll automatically develop valuable and lasting links to colleagues and clients. Strengthen crucial connections further at in-house and external networking and social events.

During the recruitment process we will negotiate your salary with you according to our guidelines. Any salary ranges published on external platforms for this position have not been agreed with KPMG and do not apply.

KPMG as an employer

Your future team

The Finance Strategy & Transformation team is a part of the Management Consulting Group, which supports clients with Finance & Controlling, Supply Chain, Procurement and IT challenges. We act as one team to provide end-to-end service offering and best value for our clients.
As a member of the Finance Strategy & Transformation team, you will continue to develop your career in a dynamic, international environment. If you are eager to work closely with global clients and leverage your full potential, this is the right position for you.More
